intro: Codonoboea craspedodroma, commonly known as the woolly codonopsis, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, glandular stems and leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. Its leaves are opposite and often have a velvety texture, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Codonoboea craspedodroma is typically found in moist, shaded environments within tropical and subtropical regions.
